channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ZOOKEEPER-1598] Ability to support more digits in the version string
item.description:
Ability to support more digits in the version string.
Zookeeper, now expects the version sting to be of X.Y.Z-# format.
With this change, the default behavior is still the same X.Y.Z-# and will not break any existing things.
But at the same time, allows people to tag on their own digits to the version strings, so that they can add a patch or two in their own environments and be able to distinguish between apache zookeeper version and locally modified zookeeper version.
item.summary: Ability to support more digits in the version string

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

This message is automatically generated.

Submitting another patch which escapes the '.' in version string.

It seems like the original regex was not only matching 2.3.4 and 2.3.4-somestring, it was also matching 2x3x4. I don't believe that was the intention of the regex.

With this patch, now it matches only the version numbers with '.'s separting the version numbers, not just any character.
